intro: Callistachys oxylobioides, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Callistachys oxylobioides is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus species.
